statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: U of the Pacific 70, UC Davis 64
article.headline: U of the Pacific 70, UC Davis 64
article.linkText: U of the Pacific 70, UC Davis 64
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- Christian Maraker scored 14 of his team-high 19 points in the second half Monday night to lead Pacific to its 12th straight win, 70-64 over UC Davis. Guillaume Yango had 14 points and 11 rebounds for the Tigers (16-2) and reserve Jasko Korajkic added 11 points. UC Davis' Ryan Moore led all scorers with 24 points. Thomas Juillerat scored 16 points and Fowzi Abdelsamad had 14 for the Aggies (8-12). Moore scored 13 of Davis' first 14 points of the second half and the pesky Aggies kept it close until Pacific pulled away in the final two minutes. UC Davis, which didn't lead in the game's final 31 minutes, twice cut Pacific's lead to one point midway through the second half. The Aggies came within two points on six other occasions but couldn't get any closer. UC Davis came made five of its first six shots of the game -- including three 3-pointers -- to take its biggest lead at 13-6. But after Rommel Marentez's 3-pointer put the Aggies ahead 16-12, Pacific assumed command by holding UC Davis scoreless over the next eight minutes. The Tigers went on an 13-0 run during that span and built an 11-point advantage before settling for a 31-24 halftime lead.
